Thymoregulators'' are ''psychotropic'' drugs whose main clinical action is to '''reduce the frequency''', '''duration''' and '''intensity''' of '''thymic episodes''' (manic and depressive).

They represent a fairly restricted pharmacological class which includes :

* lithium salts,
* anticonvulsant thymoregulators: valpromide, sodium divalproate, carbamazepine, lamotrigine, etc.

properties.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of thymoregulators?
properties.option_a: Reduce the frequency of thymic episodes
properties.option_b: Reduce the duration of thymic episodes
properties.option_c: Increase the intensity of thymic episodes
properties.option_d: Reduce the intensity of thymic episodes
